intro: Henckelia mishmiensis, commonly known as the Mishmi henckelia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
